column4: Hi all, I just installed Ubuntu on my work computer. However, I can't seem to change the ownership of any of the files on my FAT32 partitions. They're currently owned by root. And using sudo chown doesn't do it.
i don't think FAT32 supports ownership. you can use the 'umask' mount option to allow other users access to the files
I would run Knoppix and supported ownership just fine. Ditto my home computer
